group_1.textCenter: Well, then.
Tsuruno won't be leaving the bathroom@any time soon...
Should we head back?

group_1.textRight: May as well.

group_1.textLeft: I hope she's all right...

group_1.narration: Tsuruno might have been able to avoid@getting a stomachache herself...
But instead, she gulped down a@bowl of laxative-infused ramen.@So she ended up with one anyway.

group_1.textCenter: I'd never have thought of evading one of my@predictions like that!
She's really something special!

group_1.textLeft: Mel.

group_1.textRight: Yeah? What's up?

group_1.textLeft: Why did you become a Magical Girl?
I mean, you don't need to tell me if it's@hard to talk about...

group_1.textRight: Nah, it's no problem!
You know...I wasn't always into@fortune-telling.

group_1.narration: But one day I read my horoscope...@It said "Take care while traveling" and@"Your lucky item today is an umbrella"!@And I couldn't stop thinking about it.
That same day...@I was handing in a lost umbrella I found on@the train...when a paint can fell from above!
I was able to open the umbrella just@in time to save myself from the paint!
Reading the future is really cool!
When the reading is accurate,@you can use it to swerve out of danger!
After that, I got obsessed with fortunes.@I even started reading my own.

group_1.textCenter: But sometimes...I got teased because of@how obsessed I was with it.

group_1.textRight: Hey, Mel, you like fortune-telling, right?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, I love it! I can even do it myself!

group_1.textRight: Whoa. I thought you were just some horoscope@lover.

group_1.textLeft: Hmph... I can read your daily fortune or@look into your love life, no sweat!

group_1.textRight: Huuuh...
She seems like she'd get it wrong, though.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:303701:effect_emotion_angry_0][se:7219_strain]Wha!

group_1.textRight: I dunno, it sounds kinda fun! Hey, read@my fortune for me!

group_1.textLeft: Sure, I'd love to!
Let me just get out my guidebook here...@And then I'll give you a reading!

group_1.textRight: Awww.
I thought you'd do something special.
Man, what a letdown.

group_1.textLeft: H-hey, just try it! I'll do it now!
[chara:303701:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Oh no!
You're gonna be..."bitten by a dog"!

group_1.textRight: Say what?

group_1.textLeft: You don't have to worry, though! See, your@lucky item is...

group_1.textRight: Nah, I've heard enough. Your fortune-telling@is lazy as heck.
All you're doing is reading lines from@that book.

group_1.textLeft: H-hey, don't make fun of my methods!

group_1.textRight: You're getting the fortunes from reading@them out of a book. Anyone could do that.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, for real.

group_1.textRight: Hey, you wanna get crepes on the way home?

group_1.textLeft: I was thinking the same thing!
Wait!
You can't get crepes! Your lucky item today@is waffâ€•

group_1.textRight: You're putting way too much stock in this.

group_1.textLeft: See ya!

group_1.narration: That very day...@She really did end up running into a "dog".
They ignored all my advice and stopped@to get crepes on the way home.
And they crossed paths with a jerk known as@the Kamihama Mad Dog!
But they still insisted I hadn't@read their fortunes accurately.@They didn't believe in my predictions...

group_1.textCenter: When the fortune is good, tell it how it is.
If the fortune is bad, tell them how they@can avoid it.
I just want to help people out with my@fortune-telling.
But no one believes in me.
Reading fortunes from a book like I do now@means I miss the mark sometimes.
It hurts to think it, but...
If I keep doing it this way, maybe no one@will ever believe what I tell them.
What I really need is to devise my own@method of fortune-telling.
And then become a fortune-teller who never@makes a single mistake!
I can be someone who everyone turns to in@times of trouble!
After I made my wish to Kyubey...
I didn't notice any difference at first.
But when I got home and held my tarot deck...
An original style of fortune-telling just@popped into my head!
And when I used that method, my readings@came true!
100% of the time!
But while I did read good fortunes...
Occasionally, I'd read bad ones, too.@Just like the one for today...

group_1.textRight: I used to read to finds ways to avoid bad@fortunes, but...
The worse the fortune...the harder it@is to avoid its effect.

group_1.textLeft: Mel...

group_1.textRight: That's why...it doesn't always go great.
